resources.string: The #1 Thing To Remember With Meetings
Which is the core principle you have to remember with meetings?
It is important to go to every single meeting, especially as junior engineer
They are inherently expensive, as they are a pure usage of time
They are necessary for status updates
True or false: It is safer to just keep attending a meeting series, even if you are not clear exactly what value you are getting from it.
You have a meeting series where there is always action, but there is always an awkward portion at the end where people run out of topics. What should you do?
Decrease the length of the meeting
Delete the meeting
Invite more people to the meeting, so you have more to talk about
True or false: When in doubt of a meeting\'s value prop, just delete it. You can always bring it back later.
You have a 1 on 1 meeting series, and by the time of the meeting, you feel like there are a lot of issues that you two are getting to too late. What should you do?
Decrease the length of the meeting
Increase the frequency of the meeting
Push for the team to work on projects more slowly
Making Every Single Meeting You Have Effective
What do you absolutely need to with every single meeting in order to make it effective?
Talk a lot
Tell people what to do
Have a goal or set of goals for that meeting to achieve
What is the most important question you should be asking yourself constantly during a meeting?
Did someone say something wrong that I need to call out?
Is the meeting achieving its goal(s)?
How do I talk more during this meeting?
The Most Straightforward Way To Level Up Your Meetings
What is the most straightforward way to level up a meeting?
Make it longer
Write down what happens in the meeting and maintain a running set of notes
Invite more people in leadership roles to the meeting
True or false: Maintaining a good set of meeting notes can help you substantially with promotion.
Which of the following are benefits of maintaining meeting notes?
It helps you remember what happened during the meeting
It allows you to reflect on how useful a meeting series is
It shows that you care a lot about the meeting and the people within it
Taking Amazing Meeting Notes
For any meeting, what should you make sure for it?
It is clear who is responsible for taking notes
That everyone on the meeting invite is coming
That at least 5 people are on the meeting if it is a team meeting
True or false: As long as you write down most of what was said in a meeting, you have taken a good set of meeting notes.
What can you do when someone else in a meeting says something really insightful?
Stop paying attention to the meeting, so you can write it down
Stop the meeting and ask them to send an email to the entire team with that insight
Call out how you found what they just said to be very valuable and ask them for a bit of time so you can write it down
Your meeting is winding down, and you have a good set of notes of what was said during the meeting. What should you do next?
Your job is done. Tune out of the meeting
Work with the meeting group to convert what was covered in the meeting into concrete action items
Check your emails to see what you missed during the meeting
A Simple Trick To Make Your Meetings More Efficient
What can you do before a meeting to empower it to achieve more outcomes?
Meditate
Get free donuts for everyone in the meeting
Write down an agenda with discussion topics and seed it into the meeting notes document
You write down an agenda for your upcoming meeting, and you realize that it is incredibly rich and complex. What else can you do to level up the meeting?
Nothing, an agenda is all you need
Come up with some funny stories to tell during the meeting
Let everyone else on the meeting know that you have seeded it with an agenda, and you would appreciate them going through the agenda beforehand
1 on 1 Meetings Are An Exercise In Proactivity
Why should you err on the side of creating a 1 on 1 meeting instead of waiting for it to be absolutely necessary?
They are relatively cheap as they only consume the time of 2 people
1 on 1 meetings are crucial to functioning optimally within a team due to their deep relationship-building nature
The consequences of not having a 1 on 1 meeting when you should have had one are often really painful
True or false: Team meetings are more important than 1 on 1 meetings, so you should create them more aggressively for everyone to stay in sync.
